heading: Today
text: Mostly cloudy through Quebec and NY, spreading east. Spotty snow or freezing rain far north this morning, then scattered snow and rain showers from the Adirondacks and Rt. 2 north this afternoon, an inch or less over higher elevations.  Breezy and milder.  Highs in the 30s to low 40s.  Southwest winds becoming west 10 to 25 mph, gusting 30 to 40 mph.

heading: Tonight
text: A few evening snow showers, mostly from the Adirondacks and Rt. 4 north.  Gradual clearing and colder.  Lows in the teens to low 20s.  Winds northwest 10 to 15 mph through the evening, diminishing to less than 10 mph, turning to the south, west of the Green Mountains.

heading: Thursday
text: Variable clouds and sunshine.  Breezy and mild.  Highs in the 40s, some upper 30s through the northern CT Valley and northern NH.  Winds becoming south 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph east of the Green Mountains, and 15 to 25 mph, gusting 35 to 45 mph from the Green Mountains west.
